meanings.definition: Careful and shrewd, especially in business dealings.
meanings.sent1: The cannie businessman always made wise investments.
meanings.sent2: She had a cannie approach to negotiating contracts.
meanings.sent3: The cannie fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her cannie decision-making saved the company from bankruptcy.
meanings.sent5: His cannie ways of saving money impressed everyone around him.

meanings.definition: Showing good judgment or common sense.
meanings.sent1: It was cannie of him to bring an umbrella on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent2: Using a map is a cannie idea when exploring a new city.
meanings.sent3: The cannie choice of wearing sneakers to the party was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her cannie suggestion to leave early prevented traffic jams.
meanings.sent5: The cannie decision to study in advance paid off during the exam.

meanings.sent1: The magician's cannie tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: She showed a cannie ability to solve complex puzzles.
